intro: Cryptocarya hainanensis, commonly known as Hainan cryptocarya, is a species of flowering plant in the family Lauraceae. It is native to the island of Hainan in southern China, where it typically grows in humid, tropical forests. The plant is characterized by its evergreen leaves, which are glossy and elliptical in shape. Its flowers are small and clustered, often appearing in axillary inflorescences. Cryptocarya hainanensis plays a role in its native ecosystem, providing habitat and food for various insect and bird species.
